item.title: Research
item.description: Air-Sea Modeling laboratory (http://airsea.yonsei.ac.kr) The interaction between the atmosphere and the ocean is critical to the earth climate. The exchange of momentum, heat and freshwater between the atmosphere and the ocean can shape the circulations in the air and sea, and the exchange of greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide impacts the radiation balance of the climate.

item.title: [Seminar] Prof. Martin Claussen
item.description: The“Green Sahara” Prof. Martin Claussen February 13, 2019 (Wednesday) 16:00 Science Hall #551 Abstract The“Green Sahara” Pronounced changes in African climate during the transition between glacials and interglacials have been found in palaeo climatic archives, mainly in the region of today’s Sahara and Sahel.

item.title: About
item.description: 1. Overview Atmospheric Sciences present the challenges of a wide variety of problems of compelling scientific interest and increasing social relevance.
